response:
Urgent imaging is required to visualise the cord lesion and exclude surgical compression. Subsequent testing aims to identify the underlying etiology (demyelinating, infectious, or autoimmune).

investigations = ["MRI Whole Spine with contrast", "MRI Brain with contrast", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "Serum Aquaporin-4 antibodies", "Serum MOG antibodies", "ANA and ENA screen", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Lumbar Puncture (CSF analysis for oligoclonal bands, protein, glucose, cell count, culture)"]
